title: A/C Not Cold (Low Refrigerant / Leak)
symptom_short: A/C blows warm or slightly cool; worsens at idle

likely_causes.cause: Low refrigerant due to leak (O-rings, condenser, hose, evaporator)
likely_causes.notes: If it needed recharge before, there is likely a leak.

likely_causes.cause: Condenser airflow issue (fan not working / debris)
likely_causes.notes: Especially noticeable at idle or in traffic.

recommended_checks: Confirm compressor clutch engages (if equipped) when A/C is ON.
Inspect condenser for blockage and ensure cooling fans run with A/C.
Look for oily residue on A/C lines and condenser (leak clue).
Use UV dye and UV light to find small leaks (best practice).
safety_warning: Avoid DIY venting refrigerant. It’s unsafe and illegal in many places. Use proper service equipment.

title: A/C Compressor Not Engaging
symptom_short: A/C button on but compressor does not kick on
symptom_patterns: ac light on but no cold air

likely_causes.notes: Most common: system protects itself when low.

likely_causes.cause: Blown fuse / bad relay / wiring fault
Bad pressure sensor / A/C request signal issue (PCM/BCM)

recommended_checks: Check A/C fuse/relay and swap relay with identical one as test.
Scan for HVAC/PCM codes and view A/C pressure sensor reading.
Verify radiator fans run when A/C is requested.
If pressure is low, leak-test and recharge properly.
safety_warning: Jumping pressure switches is risky and can damage the compressor.

title: A/C Cold While Driving, Warm at Idle
symptom_short: Cold air at speed; warm air in traffic/idle
symptom_patterns: ac not cold at stop light

likely_causes.notes: Airflow at speed masks the problem.
Low charge reduces cooling especially at idle.

recommended_checks: Confirm condenser fan operation with A/C ON.
Inspect condenser for debris and bent fins.
Check for low refrigerant and leaks with UV dye.
safety_warning: Overheating risk may increase if fans are not working properly.

title: Heater Blows Cold / No Cabin Heat
symptom_short: Heater stays cold even when engine warms up

likely_causes.cause: Low coolant level (heater core not getting hot coolant)
likely_causes.notes: Often accompanied by overheating or gurgling noise.

likely_causes.cause: Air trapped in cooling system / improper bleeding

likely_causes.notes: One heater hose hot, the other cooler.
HVAC door not routing air through heater core.

recommended_checks: Verify coolant level when cold; check for leaks.
Feel heater hoses: both should be hot when heat is on.
Listen for blend door actuator clicking behind dash.
Check engine temperature reaches normal operating range.
safety_warning: Low coolant can lead to engine overheating and severe damage.

title: Sweet Smell Inside + Foggy Windows (Heater Core Leak)
symptom_short: Sweet coolant odor, foggy windshield, damp carpet

likely_causes.notes: Coolant vapors can fog glass and irritate breathing.

likely_causes.cause: Heater hose connection leak at firewall

recommended_checks: Inspect passenger footwell for dampness and sticky residue.
Check coolant level dropping over time.
Inspect heater hose connections at firewall for leaks.
Pressure test cooling system to confirm.
safety_warning: Breathing coolant vapor is unhealthy. Fix promptly and avoid running heat on high if leaking.

title: Cabin Blower Fan Not Working (No Airflow)
symptom_short: No air from vents on any speed (or only some speeds)

likely_causes.notes: Common: fan works only on high or certain speeds.

recommended_checks: Check HVAC blower fuse and relay.
If only high speed works, suspect resistor/module.
Listen for blower motor noise; check for power at motor connector.
safety_warning: No defrost airflow can reduce visibility in winter—address before long trips.

title: Musty/Mold Smell from Vents (A/C Odor)
symptom_short: Musty smell when A/C starts; improves after a while

likely_causes.cause: A/C drain clogged (water stays in HVAC box)
likely_causes.notes: Can cause damp carpets and odor.

recommended_checks: Replace cabin air filter.
Check A/C drain tube for proper dripping under car.
Use approved evaporator cleaner if needed.
safety_warning: Strong mold odor can irritate allergies/asthma. Fix the source (filter/drain/evaporator).

title: Weak Defrost / Poor Airflow to Windshield
symptom_short: Defrost mode selected but airflow weak or misdirected
symptom_patterns: air not coming from defrost vents
recommended_checks: Listen for actuator clicking; scan HVAC codes if supported.
Check vacuum lines (older vehicles) for cracks/disconnects.
Replace cabin air filter and verify blower performance.
safety_warning: Poor defrost reduces visibility—address immediately in freezing or rainy conditions.
